thread.title: Woman critically injured as car crashes onto footpath, hits pram in Chatswood
thread.title_full: Woman critically injured as car crashes onto footpath, hits pram in Chatswood

author: Megan Levy
title: Woman critically injured as car crashes onto footpath, hits pram in Chatswood
text:
Woman critically injured as car crashes onto footpath, hits pram in Chatswood Megan Levy twitter TWEET More 
A woman walking along a pavement on Sydney's north shore has been struck by an out-of-control car and critically injured, police say. 
Police said the Toyota sedan was travelling along Victoria Avenue near Chatswood Chase Shopping Centre in Chatswood just before 8.30am on Friday when it left the road. Woman struck by car in Chatswood Woman struck by car in Chatswood 
Police continue to make inquiries after a woman was hit by a car on Sydneyâs North Shore on Friday morning. Up Next Atlassian has a party Atlassian has a party 
Software company Atlassian cordoned off part of Sydney's Centennial Park for five days to throw a party. Restricting visitors access to the park Up Next Firefighters continue to battle factory blaze Play Video Firefighters continue to battle factory ... Firefighters continue to battle factory blaze 
Smoke continues to pour from the Chullora Resource Recovery Park, as on-site fire fighters work to get the blaze under control. Up Next Man charged over cafe owner's murder Play Video Man charged over cafe owner's murder Man charged over cafe owner's murder 
A 36-year-old man has been charged over the murder of Bill Panagakos in Sydney's west, ending a three year manhunt. Courtesy Network Ten Up Next What are your consumer rights? Play Video What are your consumer rights? What are your consumer rights? 
When are you eligible for a repair, replacement or a refund? The Australian Consumer Law gives you more rights than you might know. Up Next Online dating con-woman sent to prison Play Video Online dating con-woman sent to prison Online dating con-woman sent to prison 
Sanna Derbas, who scammed nearly three million dollars from lonely, vulnerable men she met online, has been sentenced to 18 months prison. Vision courtesy Network 10. Up Next Wesley College journal identifies sexual relationships Play Video Wesley College journal identifies sexual ... Wesley College journal identifies sexual relationships 
The University of Sydney is investigating Wesley, one of its oldest colleges after a journal that named who had sex with the most people was was distributed. More videos Woman struck by car in Chatswood 
Police continue to make inquiries after a woman was hit by a car on Sydneyâs North Shore on Friday morning. 
It first struck a pram, before hitting the woman who was walking nearby. 
The vehicle then crashed into a pole and flipped onto its side, police said. SHARE Link A woman has been critically injured after a car mounted the footpath and struck her in Chatswood. Photo: TNV 
Remarkably, the child in the pram was not injured but has been taken to a medical centre for precautionary checks. 
The injured woman has no connection to the child, police said. Advertisement 
NSW Ambulance paramedics treated the woman, believed to be in her 30s, for head injuries before taking her to Royal North Shore Hospital in a critical condition. 
"Police have been told that the child in the pram was not injured and has been taken by family to a medical centre to be checked as a precaution," a NSW Police spokeswoman said. 
"Police are yet to confirm the child's age or sex." 
The 67-year-old male driver of the vehicle was treated at the scene for minor injuries. He will be taken to hospital for mandatory blood and urine testing, police said. Pedestrian knocked over by a car at Chatswood which has veered off the road and onto the footpath @9NewsSyd pic.twitter.com/Ywn7agFQh3 — Laura Tunstall (@LauraTunstall9) February 23, 2017 
Police from North Shore Local Area Command and the Metropolitan Crash Investigation Unit are at the crash scene and have closed Victoria Avenue in both directions between Neridah and Archer streets. 
"Motorists are strongly advised to delay travel or avoid the area where possible," police said. Advertisement
